title: US forces raid Syrian town of Jarablus and 'detain a family of Iraqi origin'
text:
US forces have reportedly raided a town in northern Syria and detained an Iraqi family just a day after ISIS spokesman Abu Hassan al-Muhajir was killed in the same part of the country.

Footage circulated on social media this evening purports to show a helicopter raid by special forces that took place in the border town of Turkish-controlled Jarablus.

Local sources said a family of Iraqi origin were taken away without any kind of skirmish or confrontation.

It is not clear if the family were being arrested or not at this stage.

It comes just a day after ISIS spokesman Abu Hassan al-Muhajir was killed in the village of Ain al-Baydah near Jarablus, in a coordinated operation between SDF intelligence and the US army.

Pictures from the scene in Ain al-Baydah, which is controlled by Turkey-backed Syrian rebels, showed two vehicles hit by airstrikes, a small pick-up truck and a larger truck carrying a small metal container.

Two corpses lying outside the first vehicle while a third charred body was in the metal container.

The Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights confirmed the death of al-Muhajir, saying he was among five IS members who were killed in a US-led operation backed by the SDF.

Firefighters extinguish the flames of a burning truck at the spot where Abu Hassan al-Muhajir, the Islamic State group's spokesman was killed in a raid in the northern Syrian village of Ayn al-Bayda near Jarablus on Sunday

In a later post on Twitter, SDF spokesman Mustefa Bali said: 'We believe ISIS spox. Al-Muhajir was in Jarablus to facilitate Baghdadi's entry to Euphrates Shield area,' referring to a zone in northern Syria controlled by Turkey's Syria proxies.

Earlier on Sunday, Trump said Baghdadi was killed, dying 'like a dog,' in a daring, nighttime raid by US special forces deep in northwest Syria.

Trump said that US forces killed a 'large number' of IS militants during the raid, which culminated in Baghdadi cornered in a tunnel, where he detonated a suicide vest.

The operation to kill Baghdadi took place near a small village in northwestern Syria called Barisha, more than a 100 kilometres west of Ain al-Baydah.
description: Footage circulated on social media this evening purports to show a helicopter raid by US special forces that took place in the border town of Turkish-controlled Jarablus.
